Hi Marcin,

In this paper we didn't evolve the activation functions, but we=
 did evolve
local plasticity rules that were encoded by a CPPN:
http://eple=
x.cs.ucf.edu/papers/risi_sab10.pdf

I believe the same approach could be ad=
apted to evolve the activation
functions instead.

Best,
Sebastian

On Sun,=
 Mar 19, 2017 at 2:58 PM, mzakidalski@... [neat] <
neat@yahoogroups.c=
om> wrote:

>
>
> Hi,
>
> could you share links to articles in which NEAT/H=
yperNEAT is used to
> evolve activation functions of neural networks (e.g. =
activation function
> type, parameters of activation function)?
>
> I have =
problems with finding such publications but while evolving
> activation fun=
ction is available e.g. in MultiNEAT library I would expect
> that area to =
be covered with some kind of publications.
>
> Looking forward to hearing f=
rom you,
> Regards,
> Marcin Zakidalski
>
>
> 
>

  =
    <p>Hi,<br><br>could you share links to articles in which NEAT/HyperNEAT=
 is used to evolve activation functions of neural networks (e.g. activation=
 function type, parameters of activation function)?<br><br>I have problems =
with finding such publications but while evolving activation function is av=
ailable e.g. in MultiNEAT library I would expect that area to be covered wi=
th some kind of publications.<br><br>Looking forward to hearing from you,<b=
r>Regards,<br>Marcin Zakidalski<br></p><p><span><br class=3D"m_376541670447=
5699508yui-cursor"></span></p><p></p>
